messageBody:
Just a quick note...

I don't believe it makes sense to put rerun logic in the base class if
all of the runners don't use it. Add and adaptor or something for that
functionality that would consolidate the code and let runnners that want
to use it talk to implement rerun functionality.

=jason
[:question | ^One]

From: Vladimir Bossicard [mailto:vbossica@...]

To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] Do JUnit internals suck?!?


> Could he define the code smell "the code sucks" ?

One refactoring could improve the internal API: the rerun method is
duplicated
in the AWT and Swing runners. Move this method to the BaseTestRunner.

The following refactorings are a natural consequence of the first one:

- move all run methods into the BaseTestRunner (so that every runners
can run a
Test or a Class or a TestSuite)
- replace all the abstract methods (used to communicate with the AWT,
Swing and
Text runners by a listener.
- hide the TestResult completely and only let clients communicate with
the
listener.

And it looks very nice :-) Hopefully a future release will look nice
too. I'm
working on it.

-Vladimir
